00022 #ifndef CCN_CODING_DEFINED
00023 #define CCN_CODING_DEFINED
00024 
00025 #include <sys/types.h>
00026 #include <stddef.h>
00027 
00028 #define CCN_TT_BITS 3
00029 #define CCN_TT_MASK ((1 << CCN_TT_BITS) - 1)
00030 #define CCN_MAX_TINY ((1 << (7-CCN_TT_BITS)) - 1)
00031 #define CCN_TT_HBIT ((unsigned char)(1 << 7))
00032 
00033 /**
00034  * Type tag for a ccnb start marker.
00035  */
00036 enum ccn_tt {
00037     CCN_EXT,        /**< starts composite extension - numval is subtype */
00038     CCN_TAG,        /**< starts composite - numval is tagnamelen-1 */ 
00039     CCN_DTAG,       /**< starts composite - numval is tagdict index (enum ccn_dtag) */
00040     CCN_ATTR,       /**< attribute - numval is attrnamelen-1, value follows */
00041     CCN_DATTR,      /**< attribute numval is attrdict index */
00042     CCN_BLOB,       /**< opaque binary data - numval is byte count */
00043     CCN_UDATA,      /**< UTF-8 encoded character data - numval is byte count */
00044     CCN_NO_TOKEN    /**< should not occur in encoding */
00045 };
00046 
00047 /** CCN_CLOSE terminates composites */
00048 #define CCN_CLOSE ((unsigned char)(0))
00049 
00050 enum ccn_ext_subtype {
00051     /* skip smallest values for now */
00052     CCN_PROCESSING_INSTRUCTIONS = 16 /* <?name:U value:U?> */
00053 };
00054

00152 struct ccn_dict_entry {
00153     int index;              /**< matches enum ccn_dtag above */
00154     const char *name;       /**< textual name of dtag */
00155 };
00156 
00157 struct ccn_dict {
00158     int count;              /**< Count of elements in the table */
00159     const struct ccn_dict_entry *dict; /**< the table entries */
00160 };
00161 
00162 /**
00163  * Table for translating from DTAGs to names and vice versa.
00164  */
00165 extern const struct ccn_dict ccn_dtag_dict; /* matches enum ccn_dtag above */

00167 struct ccn_skeleton_decoder { /* initialize to all 0 */
00168     ssize_t index;          /**< Number of bytes processed */
00169     int state;              /**< Decoder state */
00170     int nest;               /**< Element nesting */
00171     size_t numval;          /**< Current numval, meaning depends on state */
00172     size_t token_index;     /**< Starting index of most-recent token */
00173     size_t element_index;   /**< Starting index of most-recent element */
00174 };
00175 
00176 /**
00177  * The decoder state is one of these, possibly with some
00178  * additional bits set for internal use.  A complete parse
00179  * ends up in state 0 or an error state.  Not all possible
00180  * error states are listed here.
00181  */
00182 enum ccn_decoder_state {
00183     CCN_DSTATE_INITIAL = 0,
00184     CCN_DSTATE_NEWTOKEN,
00185     CCN_DSTATE_NUMVAL,
00186     CCN_DSTATE_UDATA,
00187     CCN_DSTATE_TAGNAME,
00188     CCN_DSTATE_ATTRNAME,
00189     CCN_DSTATE_BLOB,
00190     /* All error states are negative */
00191     CCN_DSTATE_ERR_OVERFLOW = -1,
00192     CCN_DSTATE_ERR_ATTR     = -2,       
00193     CCN_DSTATE_ERR_CODING   = -3,
00194     CCN_DSTATE_ERR_NEST     = -4, 
00195     CCN_DSTATE_ERR_BUG      = -5
00196 };
00197 
00198 /**
00199  * If the CCN_DSTATE_PAUSE bit is set in the decoder state,
00200  * the decoder will return just after recognizing each token.
00201  * In this instance, use CCN_GET_TT_FROM_DSTATE() to extract
00202  * the token type from the decoder state;
00203  * CCN_CLOSE will be reported as CCN_NO_TOKEN.
00204  * The pause bit persists, so the end test should take that into account
00205  * by using the CCN_FINAL_DSTATE macro instead of testing for state 0.
00206  */
00207 #define CCN_DSTATE_PAUSE (1 << 15)
00208 #define CCN_GET_TT_FROM_DSTATE(state) (CCN_TT_MASK & ((state) >> 16))
00209 #define CCN_FINAL_DSTATE(state) (((state) & (CCN_DSTATE_PAUSE-1)) == 0)
00210 
00211 ssize_t ccn_skeleton_decode(struct ccn_skeleton_decoder *d,
00212                             const unsigned char *p,
00213                             size_t n);
00214 
00215 #endif
